urls.title: Know your roots- Environment Agency grants further extension to waste wood classification
urls.description: We previously reported on the Environment Agency's (" EA ") extension of the Regulatory Position Statement 207 (" RPS ") to allow completion of the waste wood classification project [1]. Whilst the RPS was due to expire on 31 January 2021, the EA have now announced a further extension until 31 July 2021 [2]. In this article, we consider reaction from the industry and potential for enforcement action. What does this extension mean? The extension of the RPS means that waste wood which has not yet been

text: Partner Rod Hunt comments on the @EnvAgency's extension of the Regulatory Position Statement 207 until 31 July 2021 to allow completion of the waste wood classification project: https://t.co/sI68tc8f5R https://t.co/5b6eC6IcbU

urls.title: Environment Agency, Defra and Esmée Fairbairn Foundation collaboration
urls.description: A collaborative pilot with the Environment Agency and Defra to support environmental projects in creating funding models which could be replicated by other projects up and down the country.

text: Through our partnership with @DefraGovUK & @EnvAgency we know there’s a real need to enable, support and catalyse exciting new models to restore our natural world. You can learn more about this work here: https://t.co/QWOvQ2kbbe

Delighted to see the launch of the Natural Environment Investment Readiness Fund from @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency 

It will provide grants of up to £100k to support organisations develop nature projects in England that can attract private investment 👇 https://t.co/F9cOKIHoMC
